comments:
09231200 build, observed on aix, does not happen on win32 or linux-motif

I'm guessing that this originates with core.  Sorry if I have the wrong
component.

If you want to use our aix box to reproduce this then visit me.

- use the PDE Plug-in Project creation wizard to create a new Hello World
plug-in project
- close the auto-opened manifest editor
- select the newly-created project, right-click -> Properties
- on the Java Compiler tab:
  - select the Use Project Settings radio
  - go to the Advanced tab
  - change the Usage of Non-Externalized Strings setting to Warning
  - OK --> let the resulting auto-rebuild go ahead
- exit eclipse and then restart
- open your new project's SampleAction.java class in the java editor
- make a change to one of the string values in its run() method, then Ctrl+S
- will get the following written to .log:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Sep 23, 2004 16:59:16.156
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in:
"org.eclipse.core.runtime".
!STACK 0
java.lang.IncompatibleClassChangeError: class java.io.File does not implement
interface org.eclipse.core.resources.IContainer
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.util.Util.findFirstClassFile(Util.java(Compiled
Code))
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.util.Util.getJdkLevel(Util.java(Compiled
Code))
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.ClasspathEntry.validateClasspathEntry(ClasspathEntry.java:1084)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaProject.getResolvedClasspath(JavaProject.java:1946)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaProject.getResolvedClasspath(JavaProject.java:1848)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessor.updateClasspathMarkers(DeltaProcessor.java:2062)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessor.updateClasspathMarkers(DeltaProcessor.java:2092)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessor.updateClasspathMarkers(DeltaProcessor.java:2108)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessor.resourceChanged(DeltaProcessor.java:1812)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessingState.resourceChanged(DeltaProcessingState.java:414)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager$2.run(NotificationManager.java:283)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java(Inlined
Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java(Compiled Code))
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.notify(NotificationManager.java:277)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.broadcastChanges(NotificationManager.java:151)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.broadcastChanges(AutoBuildJob.java:78)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.doBuild(AutoBuildJob.java:153)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.AutoBuildJob.run(AutoBuildJob.java:212)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

This is just too weird... looks like a compiler or VM error. Adding Olivier just
in case they have any idea of what could be causing this. Grant, what is the VM
you are running on?

java version "1.4.1"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.1)
Classic VM (build 1.4.1, J2RE 1.4.1 IBM AIX build ca141-20030522 (JIT enabled: 
jitc))

Looks like a VM bug. I disabled the JIT compiler (-Djava.compiler=no)and could
not reproduce the problem any longer.

Grant will try to reproduce it on more recent VM.
Grant, please reopen if you see this with a newer VM. Thanks.

traces.message: class java.io.File does not implement interface org.eclipse.core.resources.IContainer
